member.name: M:Pchp.Library.Zlib.gzdecode(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: This function returns a decoded version of the input data.
member.param: The data to decode, encoded by gzencode().
The maximum length of data to decode.
member.returns: The decoded string, or FALSE if an error occurred.

member.name: M:Pchp.Library.Zlib.gzencode(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: This function returns a compressed version of the input data compatible with the output of the gzip program.
member.param: The level of compression. Can be given as 0 for no compression up to 9 for maximum compression. If not given, the default compression level will be the default compression level of the zlib library.

param.name: encoding_mode
param.para: The encoding mode. Can be FORCE_GZIP (the default) or FORCE_DEFLATE.
If you use FORCE_DEFLATE, you get a standard zlib deflated string (inclusive zlib headers) after the gzip file header but without the trailing crc32 checksum.

member.returns: The encoded string, or FALSE if an error occurred.

member.name: M:Pchp.Library.Zlib.gzeof(Pchp.Core.PhpResource)
member.summary: Tests the given GZ file pointer for EOF.
member.param: The gz-file pointer. It must be valid, and must point to a file successfully opened by gzopen().
member.returns: Returns TRUE if the gz-file pointer is at EOF or an error occurs; otherwise returns FALSE.

member.name: M:Pchp.Library.Zlib.gzrewind(Pchp.Core.PhpResource)
member.summary: Sets the file position indicator of the given gz-file pointer to the beginning of the file stream.
member.param: The gz-file pointer. It must be valid, and must point to a file successfully opened by gzopen().
member.returns: Returns TRUE on success or FALSE on failure.

member.name: M:Pchp.Library.Zlib.gzseek(Pchp.Core.PhpResource,System.Int32,System.Int32)

summary.para: Sets the file position indicator for the given file pointer to the given offset byte into the file stream. Equivalent to calling (in C) gzseek(zp, offset, SEEK_SET).

If the file is opened for reading, this function is emulated but can be extremely slow. If the file is opened for writing, only forward seeks are supported; gzseek() then compresses a sequence of zeroes up to the new starting position.

member.param: The gz-file pointer. It must be valid, and must point to a file successfully opened by gzopen().
whence values are: SEEK_SET (relative to origin), SEEK_CUR (relative to current position).
member.returns: Upon success, returns 0; otherwise, returns -1. Note that seeking past EOF is not considered an error.

member.name: M:Pchp.Library.Zlib.gzseek64(Pchp.Core.PhpResource,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Calls gzseek Some versions of linux have the function named differently, which is used in some PHP libraries

member.name: M:Pchp.Library.Zlib.gztell(Pchp.Core.PhpResource)
member.summary: Gets the position of the given file pointer; i.e., its offset into the uncompressed file stream.
member.param: The gz-file pointer. It must be valid, and must point to a file successfully opened by gzopen().
member.returns: The position of the file pointer or FALSE if an error occurs.

member.name: M:Pchp.Library.Zlib.gztell64(Pchp.Core.PhpResource)
member.summary:
Gets the position of the given file pointer; i.e., its offset into the uncompressed file stream.
Some versions of linux have the function named differently, which is used in some PHP libraries

member.name: M:Pchp.Library.Zlib.gzfile(Pchp.Core.Context,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: This function is identical to readgzfile(), except that it returns the file in an array.
member.param: Current script context, passed automatically by the caller.
You can set this optional parameter to 1, if you want to search for the file in the include_path too.
member.returns: An array containing the file, one line per cell.

member.name: M:Pchp.Library.Zlib.gzgetc(Pchp.Core.Context,Pchp.Core.PhpResource)
member.summary: Returns a string containing a single (uncompressed) character read from the given gz-file pointer.
member.param: The gz-file pointer. It must be valid, and must point to a file successfully opened by gzopen().
member.returns: The uncompressed character or FALSE on EOF (unlike gzeof()).

member.name: M:Pchp.Library.Zlib.gzgets(Pchp.Core.PhpResource,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a (uncompressed) string of up to length - 1 bytes read from the given file pointer. Reading ends when length - 1 bytes have been read, on a newline, or on EOF (whichever comes first).
member.param: The gz-file pointer. It must be valid, and must point to a file successfully opened by gzopen().
The length of data to get.
member.returns: The uncompressed string, or FALSE on error.

members.member:
Identical to gzgets(), except that gzgetss() attempts to strip any HTML and PHP tags from the text it reads.
The gz-file pointer. It must be valid, and must point to a file successfully opened by gzopen(). The length of data to get. /// You can use this optional parameter to specify tags which should not be stripped. The uncompressed and striped string, or FALSE on error.

member.name: M:Pchp.Library.Zlib.gzpassthru(Pchp.Core.Context,Pchp.Core.PhpResource)
member.summary: Reads to EOF on the given gz-file pointer from the current position and writes the (uncompressed) results to standard output.
member.param: The gz-file pointer. It must be valid, and must point to a file successfully opened by gzopen().
member.returns: The number of uncompressed characters read from gz and passed through to the input, or FALSE on error.

member.name: M:Pchp.Library.Zlib.gzputs(Pchp.Core.Context,Pchp.Core.PhpResource,Pchp.Core.PhpString,System.Int32)
member.summary: This function is an alias of gzwrite(), which writes the contents of string to the given gz-file.
member.param: The gz-file pointer. It must be valid, and must point to a file successfully opened by gzopen().
The number of uncompressed bytes to write. If supplied, writing will stop after length (uncompressed) bytes have been written or the end of string is reached, whichever comes first.
member.returns: Returns the number of (uncompressed) bytes written to the given gz-file stream.

member.name: M:Pchp.Library.Zlib.gzread(Pchp.Core.Context,Pchp.Core.PhpResource,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads up to length bytes from the given gz-file pointer. Reading stops when length (uncompressed) bytes have been read or EOF is reached, whichever comes first.
member.param: The gz-file pointer. It must be valid, and must point to a file successfully opened by gzopen().
The number of bytes to read.
member.returns: The data that have been read.

member.name: M:Pchp.Library.Zlib.gzwrite(Pchp.Core.Context,Pchp.Core.PhpResource,Pchp.Core.PhpString,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes the contents of string to the given gz-file.
member.param: The gz-file pointer. It must be valid, and must point to a file successfully opened by gzopen().
The number of uncompressed bytes to write. If supplied, writing will stop after length (uncompressed) bytes have been written or the end of string is reached, whichever comes first.
member.returns: Returns the number of (uncompressed) bytes written to the given gz-file stream.

member.name: M:Pchp.Library.Zlib.readgzfile(Pchp.Core.Context,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a file, decompresses it and writes it to standard output.
member.param: The file name. This file will be opened from the filesystem and its contents written to standard output.
You can set this optional parameter to 1, if you want to search for the file in the include_path too.
member.returns: Returns the number of (uncompressed) bytes read from the file. If an error occurs, FALSE is returned and unless the function was called as @readgzfile, an error message is printed.

member.name: M:Pchp.Library.Zlib.zlib_get_coding_type
member.summary: Returns the coding type used for output compression.
member.returns: Possible return values are gzip, deflate, or FALSE.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.zlib.SupportClass.ReadInput(System.IO.Stream,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a number of characters from the current source Stream and writes the data to the target array at the specified index.
member.param: The source Stream to read from.
Contains the array of characteres read from the source Stream.
The starting index of the target array.
The maximum number of characters to read from the source Stream.
member.returns: The number of characters read. The number will be less than or equal to count depending on the data available in the source Stream. Returns -1 if the end of the stream is reached.

member.returns: The number of characters read. The number will be less than or equal to count depending on the data available in the source TextReader. Returns -1 if the end of the stream is reached.
